intro: Hieracium chubutense, commonly known as the Chubut hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Argentina. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid regions, adapting to harsh environmental conditions. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow with a distinctive central disc. Hieracium chubutense is often found in grasslands and rocky areas, where it plays a minor role in local ecosystems.
